skillTree.localised_description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
Such utterly ludicrous, impossible geometry could not conceivably be the product of a sane mind; sight of it drives the untainted mad and melts their brains!

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Ruin subtly corrupts a populace from the very depths of their souls; the resultant favour feeds the Dark Powers' servants and spurs them ever onwards.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Through dangerous manipulation of the winds of magic, the Shaman uses Dhar to taint the very land, turning it against the southerners.

effects.description:
Attrition: +10% casualties suffered from Chaos Undivided corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition
	(enemy armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: Take it all!
Don't kill everyone, we will be back.
Fields fall fallow when this Shaman-Sorcerer wills it, empowering himself with the land's very life blood.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +2
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Through animal entrails, smoke, and soot this one can pinpoint an enemy stronghold's smallest weaknesses.

effects.description:
Leadership: +1 when laying siege or encircling
	(Hero's army)

Leadership: +2 when laying siege or encircling
	(Hero's army)

Leadership: +3 when laying siege or encircling
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the Norscan's hold their traditions and the presence of a Vikti can embolden our tribe.
Tales of this one's body count have reached the ears of every fighting man in the tribe, and they are happy to help pile the corpses higher.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1 for Marauder units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +1 for Marauder units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: Drain the winds of magic before the enemy can turn them against us.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing
	(all units in army)

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Practiced in the art of casting; always with a spell at the ready.
Your life is balanced on the edge of a knife when drawing from the winds. Too swift, and the winds will claim your life. Too slow, and the enemy will.

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: -1%
	(own characters in region)

Miscast base chance: -2%
	(own characters in region)

Miscast base chance: -4%
	(own characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: He who casts the first spell draws first blood.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: -2 per turn
	(enemy armies in region)

Winds of Magic power reserve: -4 per turn
	(enemy armies in region)

Winds of Magic power reserve: -6 per turn
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: With the right amount of preparation, everything can harnessed to empower even the soldierâ€™s mundane weapons.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% when attacking
	(own armies in region)

Weapon strength: +2% when attacking
	(own armies in region)

Weapon strength: +3% when attacking
	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: No one is allowed in or out without my express permission. This is for their safety, of course.
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -3%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -8%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -15%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +20%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Why forlorn? Are you not a king, an emperor â€“ a champion?"

effects.description: Hero self-defence: -10% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A calming presence can be a steadying handâ€¦ but also disquieting.
An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Skulk and sneak or shadow and stalk, theirs is a guileful nature.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
I feel daemonic power within me!
Give own power to others... Not very wise.
Spawns gather around him and hear his commands.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Fimir Warrior units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaos Trolls are highly honoured in the eyes of the Changer of the Ways, for rarely does any creature combine mutation with such size, power, and sheer vitality.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Norscan Trolls & Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Physically powerful, armed and armoured with both steel and sorcery, filled with evil intent. Are they even Human?

effects.description:
Upkeep: -4% for Marauder units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaos Giants are instinctively drawn to those who bear the favour of the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Norscan Giant units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +4 for Norscan Giant units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The blood of our enemies lies here...
Chosen wont serve this little worm, step aside!
The Chaos Gods look on us and smile, there is only war!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Forsaken by the Gods, now, they fight only out of a dark, unnatural hunger and madness.
